ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I  was able to see the process of developing a play from the initial drafting process to a show's development in workshops and festivals. I also understand the structure and goals of playwriting.
I didnt learn much besides information from two books that I could have read on my own anyway.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The synopsis on Yale Course Search did not actually align with what the course was about. The Professor later changed the syllabus to reflect what we had actually been doing.
I felt at times the reading was dense and hard to engage both my knowledge of the current play and the supplementary readings in discussion.
The application of the concepts was unclear and class structure was unorganized.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! It provided great insight to the process of the theater industry today.
Unless you already know you are interested in new play development, not really. Most students were checked out the whole time
